medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive hepatoencephalopathy in siblings due to mitochondrial translation defects.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The index patient exhibited profound metabolic acidosis from day 10 of life, with blood lactate levels at 17.1 mmol per liter. Liver dysfunction began on day 7, progressed to full liver failure by day 12, leading to death on day 27. The male sibling was born at 41 weeks, with signs of liver failure at week 7 and death at five months.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both siblings displayed severe defects in mitochondrial translation and reduced levels of oxidative phosphorylation complexes.
medical_history.family_history: Parents were consanguineous Lebanese (first cousins). Both siblings had significant metabolic and liver issues.
